title: Robert Trent Jones Jr.
text:
Robert Trent "Bobby" Jones Jr. (born July 24, 1939) is an American <a href="golf%20course%20architect">golf course architect</a>. He is the son of <a href="golf%20course%20designer">golf course designer</a> <a href="Robert%20Trent%20Jones">Robert Trent Jones</a> and the brother of golf course designer <a href="Rees%20Jones">Rees Jones</a>.
Background.
Jones was born in <a href="Montclair%2C%20New%20Jersey">Montclair, New Jersey</a> and graduated from <a href="Montclair%20High%20School%20%28New%20Jersey%29">Montclair High School</a> in 1957. After attending <a href="Yale%20University">Yale</a> and graduate studies at <a href="Stanford%20University">Stanford University</a>, he joined his father's firm, Robert Trent Jones Incorporated. He rose to become <a href="vice-president">vice-president</a> of the company and assumed control of <a href="West%20Coast%20of%20the%20United%20States">west coast</a> operations in 1962.
In the 1960s, he began designing courses on his own and formed his own company in the early 1970s in <a href="Palo%20Alto%2C%20California">Palo Alto, California</a>. He has since designed or remodeled more than 250 golf courses during his career.
Jones continues to design courses and currently resides in <a href="Woodside%2C%20California">Woodside, California</a>. He has also served as the president of the <a href="American%20Society%20of%20Golf%20Course%20Architects">American Society of Golf Course Architects</a>, former Chairman of the California State Park and Recreation Commission and has published a book entitled "Golf by Design" designed to help players understand golf course layout.
